title: Set Up Google Tag Manager with Google Analytics GA4
excerpt: Learn how to use Google Tag Manager with Google Analytics GA4 to effectively track your website's performance.
content:
Google Tag Manager and Google Analytics GA4 are essential tools for managing tags and analyzing your website's performance. Follow this guide to set them up easily.

1. Create a Google Tag Manager Account

To get started:

  1. Go to the official Google Tag Manager website and log in with your Google account.
  2. Create an account by entering your email address and follow the steps to generate a container for your website.
  3. Add the code provided by Google Tag Manager to your project. This code must be inserted into the <head> and <body> sections of your index.html file.

2. Configure a Tag for Google Analytics GA4

In Google Tag Manager:

  1. Create a new tag and choose Google Analytics GA4 as the tag type.
  2. Retrieve the measurement ID (starting with G-) from Google Analytics under the Data Streams tab.
  3. Enter this ID in the tag configuration.
  4. Add a trigger, such as Page View, to activate the tag when users visit a page on your site.

3. Deploy and Test the Configuration

Once the tag is configured:

  • Click Submit to publish your changes in Google Tag Manager. Ensure the code is correctly inserted in the <head> and <body> sections of your HTML file.
  • Use the Preview option to test the configuration. Make sure the tag is detected and sends data to Google Analytics.

4. Verify the Configuration in Google Analytics

Once the tag is active, verify everything is working correctly:

  • Go to the Real-Time section in Google Analytics to confirm that data is being transmitted.
  • Ensure that events and configured conversions appear as expected in GA4 reports.

Conclusion

By combining Google Tag Manager and Google Analytics GA4, you simplify tag management and gain a detailed view of your website's performance. These centralized tools allow you to efficiently optimize your tracking and analytics.
